alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 07 at 10:28PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BANDS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW TO CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING... Bands of moderate to heavy snow will persist across the Anchorage Bowl and Matanuska Valley through early Monday morning. Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible in these bands. 3 to 6 inches of snow have already fallen across the area. An additional 2 to 4 inches of snow are possible before these bands taper off. As of 10:15 PM, the snow bands are beginning to taper off over Turnagain Arm. The snow is expected to taper off from south to north through the next several hours. While snow is expected to end around 1 AM for most of Anchorage, snow may continue until 6 AM for the Palmer and Wasilla area. Expect significantly reduced visibilities in these heavy snow bands. Motorists are urged to slow down and use caution when travelling.
